title: Sant Dnyaneshwar Temple, Alandi
subtitle: Sacred Samadhi of Saint Dnyaneshwar – The Divine Poet of Maharashtra
overview: Alandi, located on the banks of the Indrayani River near Pune, is one of the most revered pilgrimage towns in Maharashtra.
It is best known for the temple and Samadhi of Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj, the 13th-century saint, philosopher, and author of the revered ‘Dnyaneshwari’.
Every year, thousands of Warkaris (devotees of Lord Vitthal) visit Alandi during the Pandharpur Wari, carrying the symbolic palanquin (Palkhi) of Dnyaneshwar Maharaj to Pandharpur.
Alandi’s spiritual atmosphere, rhythmic chants, and river rituals make it a center of devotion and learning in the Bhakti movement.

highlights.title: Spiritual Significance
highlights.description: Samadhi of Sant Dnyaneshwar Maharaj, a central figure of the Bhakti tradition in Maharashtra.

highlights.title: Dnyaneshwari Legacy
highlights.description: The temple preserves the teachings and writings of the saint who translated the Bhagavad Gita into Marathi.

geography.intro: Alandi is a serene town on the banks of the holy Indrayani River, located about 25 km from Pune.

details.label: Temple Architecture
details.value: Traditional Peshwa-era style with ornate woodwork and shikhara

details.label: Major Festivals
details.value: Dnyaneshwar Palkhi Wari, Kartik Ekadashi, Ashadhi Ekadashi

climate.description: Alandi has a tropical climate with warm summers and mild winters.

seasons.text: Best time to visit: October to February
Monsoon months bring lush surroundings and river abundance.

geography.conclusion: Alandi stands as a timeless spiritual center, inspiring countless devotees and seekers through the divine teachings of Dnyaneshwar Maharaj.

activities.title: Darshan and Samadhi Puja
activities.description: Devotees visit the sacred Samadhi and offer flowers, oil lamps, and prayers.
info: Temple opens at 4:00 AM for Kakad Aarti.
Evening Aarti and Bhajans held daily.

activities.title: Wari Pilgrimage Participation
activities.description: Join thousands of Warkaris in the famous Pandharpur Wari procession starting from Alandi.
info: Devotees chant ‘Gyanba Tukaram!’ along the route.

activities.title: Holy Dip in Indrayani
activities.description: Pilgrims take a dip in the sacred Indrayani River before visiting the temple.
info: Ritual believed to purify body and mind.
Best time: Early morning or during festival days.

attractions.title: Indrayani Ghat
attractions.description: Peaceful ghats along the Indrayani River for meditation and ritual bathing.

attractions.title: Palkhi Start Point
attractions.description: Historic site where the annual Palkhi procession begins, carrying the Padukas (holy sandals) of the saint.

attractions.title: Siddheshwar Temple
attractions.description: Ancient Shiva temple near Alandi, visited by devotees seeking blessings before Samadhi darshan.

marineLife.intro: Alandi’s spiritual setting by the Indrayani River nurtures a calm river ecosystem.

items.title: River Species
items.description: The Indrayani supports freshwater fish and aquatic plants, adding to its serenity.

items.title: Eco Conservation
items.description: Local volunteers and devotees often organize cleanliness drives to protect the holy river.

conclusion: The Indrayani’s gentle flow mirrors the peaceful teachings of Saint Dnyaneshwar.
Its sacred waters symbolize purity and devotion.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Nearest railway station: Pune Junction (28 km).
Frequent trains connect Pune with Mumbai, Nashik, and Solapur.

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Alandi is well connected by road from Pune (25 km) via Dighi–Moshi road.
Regular MSRTC buses and shared autos are available.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Pune International Airport (21 km).

bookingTips.description: Simple lodges, dharmashalas, and ashrams available near the temple for pilgrims.
Carry drinking water; temple area can be crowded during festivals.
Participate in morning Bhajans or read excerpts from Dnyaneshwari for spiritual upliftment.
